page.title: 02 St.Cleer Church.
page.content: The granite Church of St.Clarus has 3 aisles ,and was built in 1200 A.D. In 1300 the Church was made bigger and the old Norman door was put in the north wall. There are four stained glass windows on either side. Inside, the chancel roof has carved angels playing musical instruments. There is a photo of the Turin Shroud showing Jesus' face, and his eyes seem to move. Behind the organ there is the tomb of the Langeford family of 1614. If anybody could say the Creed on it by heart they would get 8d worth of bread every week. The stocks cost 10/6 in 1744. Around the walls are painted texts from 1660, and the royal coat of arms of Queen Anne. At the back of the church there is a board with the names of all vicars since the church was built. A new board has been given recently by the Honicombe family
